name: UI Color Palette
description:
UI Color Palette generates accessible color palettes from your brand’s colors with consistant lightness and contrast. The plugin uses the LCH color model to generate colors variants according to the chosen lightness scale. This model is relevant to make colors compliant with the WCAG standards.


Create a color palette from your brand’s color

Select directly some starting colors on your Figma document canvas, then set the lightness scale up from 50 (the brightest) to 900 (the darkest). Finally, create a complete and fully accessible color palette for your UI.


Edit a color palette and deploy it

Edit the lightness scale to tweak every color of the palette. Then, you can add them as document local styles or update the existing ones. Finally, publish the document to deploy those colors through the team or the organization.


Bugs reports & feature requests

If you find a bug or want to take part in the plugin’s evolution, go to this GitHub Issues page and open a ticket: https://github.com/inVoltag/figma-ui-color-palette/issues.


The plugin is open-source. Find the complete documentation on the repository README: https://github.com/inVoltag/figma-ui-color-palette
